instruction: List all methods to create curves in RhinoCommon
code:
# RhinoCommon methods for creating curves:
  AngularDimension.Create: The angle between the lines is dimensioned. If the lines intersect in a single point, that point is used as the center of the angular dimension arc.In this case, there are eight possible angles to dimension.The pointOnAngularDimensionArc and pointOnLine parameters are used to select the correct angle to dimension. If a pointOnLine parameter is not set, the corresponding line's midpoint is used. If the lines are colinear, the point on the line closest to pointOnAngularDimensionArc is the center of the angular dimension arc.
  AngularDimension.Create: Creates an angular dimension with extension lines starting at plane origin (arc center).
  AngularDimension.GetDisplayLines
  AnnotationBase.FirstCharProperties: Extracts the font properties (bold, italic, underline, and facename) from the first character run of an RTF string.
  AnnotationBase.FormatRtfString: Modifies the formatting of an RTF (Rich Text Format) string by setting or clearing bold, italic, underline, and font face properties on the first character run.
  AnnotationBase.IsAllUnderlined: Returns True if all of the text in the annotation is Underlined, otherwise returns false
  AnnotationBase.SetUnderline
  Arc.BoundingBox: Computes the 3D axis aligned bounding box for this arc.
  Arc.ClosestParameter: Gets parameter on the arc closest to a test point.
  Arc.ClosestPoint: Computes the point on an arc that is closest to a test point.
  Arc.EpsilonEquals: Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this
  Arc.Equals: Determines whether another arc has the same value as this arc.
  Arc.Equals: Determines whether another object is an arc and has the same value as this arc.
  Arc.GetHashCode: Computes a hash code for the present arc.
  Arc.PointAt: Gets the point at the given arc parameter.
  Arc.Reverse: Reverses the orientation of the arc. Changes the domain from [a,b] to [-b,-a].
  Arc.TangentAt: Gets the tangent at the given parameter.
  Arc.ToNurbsCurve: Initializes a nurbs curve representation of this arc. This amounts to the same as calling NurbsCurve.CreateFromArc().
  Arc.ToNurbsCurve: Create a uniform non-rational cubic NURBS approximation of an arc.
  Arc.Transform: Transforms the arc using a Transformation matrix.
  Arc.Trim: Sets the arc's angle domain (in radians) to the specified interval, provided it is increasing and its length does not exceed 2.0 * Math.PI (plus a small tolerance). If the interval length exceeds 2.0 * Math.PI it will be clamped to exactly 2.0 * Math.PI. Returns True if the domain was set successfully, False otherwise.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes an AreaMassProperties for a closed planar curve.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes an AreaMassProperties for a closed planar curve.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes the AreaMassProperties for a collection of geometric objects. At present only Breps, Surfaces, Meshes and Planar Closed Curves are supported.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes the Area properties for a collection of geometric objects. At present only Breps, Surfaces, Meshes and Planar Closed Curves are supported.
  BezierCurve.CreateBeziers: Create an array of Bezier curves that fit to an existing curve. Please note, these Beziers can be of any order and may be rational.
  BezierCurve.CreateCubicBeziers: Constructs an array of cubic, non-rational Beziers that fit a curve to a tolerance.
  BezierCurve.CreateLoftedBezier: Loft a bezier through a list of points
  BezierCurve.CreateLoftedBezier: Loft a bezier through a list of points
  BezierCurve.ChangeDimension: Change dimension of bezier.
  BezierCurve.CurvatureAt: Evaluate the curvature vector at a curve parameter.
  BezierCurve.Dispose: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.
  BezierCurve.GetBoundingBox: Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the curve.
  BezierCurve.GetControlVertex2d: Get location of a control vertex.
  BezierCurve.GetControlVertex3d: Gets the 3D location of a control vertex at the specified index.
  BezierCurve.GetControlVertex4d: Gets the homogeneous (4D) value of a control vertex at the specified index.
  BezierCurve.GetObjectData: Populates a System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo with the data needed to serialize the target object.
  BezierCurve.IncreaseDegree: Increase degree of bezier
  BezierCurve.MakeNonRational: Make bezier non-rational
  BezierCurve.MakeRational: Make bezier rational
  BezierCurve.PointAt: Evaluates point at a curve parameter.
  BezierCurve.Split: Divides the Bezier curve at the specified parameter.
  BezierCurve.TangentAt: Evaluates the unit tangent vector at a curve parameter.
  BezierCurve.ToNurbsCurve: Constructs a NURBS curve representation of this curve.
  BezierSurface.CreateLoftedBezier: Loft a bezier surface through a list of bezier curves.
  BezierSurface.ToNurbsSurface: Constructs a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
  Brep.CopyTrimCurves: Copy all trims from a Brep face onto a surface.
  Brep.CreateBaseballSphere: Creates a brep representation of the sphere with two similar trimmed NURBS surfaces, and no singularities.
  Brep.CreateBlendShape: Makes a curve blend between points on two surface edges. The blend will be tangent to the surfaces and perpendicular to the edges.
  Brep.CreateContourCurves: Constructs the contour curves for a brep, using a slicing plane.

  Brep.CreateBooleanIntersection: Compute the Solid Intersection of two Breps.

  Brep.CreateBooleanSplit: Splits shared areas of Breps and creates separate Breps from the shared and unshared parts.

instruction: List all methods to create meshes in RhinoCommon
code:
# RhinoCommon methods for creating meshes:
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes the AreaMassProperties for a collection of geometric objects. At present only Breps, Surfaces, Meshes and Planar Closed Curves are supported.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes the Area properties for a collection of geometric objects. At present only Breps, Surfaces, Meshes and Planar Closed Curves are supported.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Compute the AreaMassProperties for a single Mesh.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes an AreaMassProperties for a mesh.
  Brep.CreateCurvatureAnalysisMesh: Create an array of analysis meshes for the brep using the specified settings. Meshes aren't set on the brep.
  Brep.CreateFromMesh: Create a brep representation of a mesh
  Brep.CreateQuadSphere: Constructs a Brep definition of a quad sphere.
  BrepFace.GetMesh: Obtains a reference to a specified type of mesh for this brep face.
  BrepFace.SetMesh: Sets a reference to a specified type of mesh for this brep face.
  MeshFaceList.AddFace: Appends a new mesh face to the end of the mesh face list.
  MeshFaceList.AddFace: Appends a new quadrangular face to the end of the mesh face list.
  MeshFaceList.AddFace: Appends a new triangular face to the end of the mesh face list.
  MeshFaceList.AddFaces: Appends a list of faces to the end of the mesh face list.
  MeshFaceList.AdjacentFaces: Gets all faces that share a topological edge with a given face.
  MeshFaceList.Clear: Clears the Face list on the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.ConvertNonPlanarQuadsToTriangles: Splits non-planar quads into two triangles based on given parameters.
  MeshFaceList.ConvertQuadsToTriangles: Splits all quads along the short diagonal.
  MeshFaceList.ConvertTrianglesToQuads: Joins adjacent triangles into quads if the resulting quad is 'nice'.
  MeshFaceList.CullDegenerateFaces: Attempts to removes degenerate faces from the mesh. Degenerate faces are faces that contains such a combination of indices, that their final shape collapsed in a line or point. Before returning, this method also attempts to repair faces by juggling vertex indices.
  MeshFaceList.DeleteFaces: Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  MeshFaceList.DeleteFaces: Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  MeshFaceList.Destroy: Releases all memory allocated to store faces. The list capacity will be 0 after this call. Subsequent calls can add new items.
  MeshFaceList.ExtractDuplicateFaces: Extracts, or removes, duplicate faces.
  MeshFaceList.ExtractFaces: Extracts, or removes, faces.
  MeshFaceList.GetClashingFacePairs: Gets an array of pairs of mesh faces that clash.
  MeshFaceList.GetConnectedFaces: Find all connected face indices where adjacent face normals meet the criteria of angleRadians and greaterThanAngle
  MeshFaceList.GetConnectedFaces: Find all connected face indices
  MeshFaceList.GetConnectedFacesToEdges: Uses startFaceIndex and finds all connected face indexes up to unwelded or naked edges. If treatNonmanifoldLikeUnwelded is True then non-manifold edges will be considered as unwelded or naked
  MeshFaceList.GetDuplicateFaces: Finds all of the duplicate faces.
  MeshFaceList.GetEnumerator: Gets an enumerator that yields all faces in this collection.
  MeshFaceList.GetFace: Returns the mesh face at the given index.
  MeshFaceList.GetFaceAspectRatio: Returns the mesh face at the given index.
  MeshFaceList.GetFaceBoundingBox: Gets the bounding box of a face.
  MeshFaceList.GetFaceCenter: Gets the center point of a face. For a triangular face, this is the centroid or barycenter. For a quad, this is the average of four comer points.
  MeshFaceList.GetFaceVertices: Gets the 3D location of the vertices forming a face.
  MeshFaceList.GetTopologicalVertices: Gets the topology vertex indices of a face.
  MeshFaceList.GetZeroAreaFaces: Examines and adds face indexes to whollyDegenerateFaces if the face is a triangle with zero area or a quad both triangles have zero area. Face indexes are added to partiallyDegenerateFaces when a quad has one triangle with zero area.
  MeshFaceList.HasNakedEdges: Returns True if at least one of the face edges are not topologically connected to any other faces.
  MeshFaceList.Insert: Inserts a mesh face at a defined index in this list.
  MeshFaceList.IsHidden: Gets a value indicating whether a face is hidden. A face is hidden if, and only if, at least one of its vertices is hidden.
  MeshFaceList.MergeAdjacentFaces: Merges two triangular mesh faces that share an edge into one quadrangular face.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveAt: Removes a face from the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveAt: Removes a face from the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveZeroAreaFaces: Deletes or fixes mesh faces that have zero area.
  MeshFaceList.SetFace: Sets a face at a specific index of the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.SetFace: Sets a quadrangular face at a specific index of the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.SetFace: Sets a triangular face at a specific index of the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.ToIntArray: Copies all of the faces to a linear array of indices. Clean-up of vertex indices if replacedIndices is a valid List
  MeshFaceList.ToIntArray: Copies all of the face indices to a linear array of indices per face. Note that this includes indices from invalid faces too.
  MeshFaceNormalList.AddFaceNormal: Appends a face normal to the list of mesh face normals.

instruction: List all transformation methods in RhinoCommon
code:
# RhinoCommon methods for transformations:
  AnnotationBase.GetDimensionScale: Get view dependent dimension scale
  AnnotationBase.GetBoundingBox: Aligned bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the transformed geometry.
  Arc.Reverse: Reverses the orientation of the arc. Changes the domain from [a,b] to [-b,-a].
  Arc.Transform: Transforms the arc using a Transformation matrix.
  BezierSurface.Transform: Transforms the surface
  BoundingBox.Transform: Updates this bounding box to be the smallest axis aligned bounding box that contains the transformed result of its 8 original corner points.
  Box.Transform: Transforms this Box using a Transformation matrix. If the Transform does not preserve Similarity, the dimensions of the resulting box cannot be trusted.
  Brep.Append: Appends a copy of another brep to this and updates indices of appended brep parts. Duplicates are not removed
  Brep.Flip: Reverses entire brep orientation of all faces.
  Brep.IsOrientedManifold: Test a Brep to see if it is an oriented manifold. Non manifold Breps have at least one edge that is shared among three or more faces.
  Brep.PushPullExtend: If the brep.Faces[faceIndex] is planar, and all the adjacent faces are planar, this function transforms brep.Faces[faceIndex] with the transform parameter and recomputes the adjacent faces. See the PushPull commands extend mode.
  Brep.RemoveFins: Recursively removes any Brep face with a naked edge. This function is only useful for non-manifold Breps.
  Brep.RemoveHoles: Removes inner loops, or holes, in a Brep.
  Brep.RemoveHoles: Remove all inner loops, or holes, in a Brep.
  Brep.Standardize: Standardizes all trims, edges, and faces in the brep. After standardizing, there may be unused curves and surfaces in the brep. Call Brep.Compact to remove these unused curves and surfaces.
  Brep.TransformComponent: Transform an array of Brep components, bend neighbors to match, and leave the rest fixed.
  Brep.Trim: Trims a brep with an oriented cutter. The parts of the brep that lie inside (opposite the normal) of the cutter are retained while the parts to the outside (in the direction of the normal) are discarded. If the Cutter is closed, then a connected component of the Brep that does not intersect the cutter is kept if and only if it is contained in the inside of cutter. That is the region bounded by cutter opposite from the normal of cutter, If cutter is not closed all these components are kept.
  Brep.Trim: Trims a Brep with an oriented cutter. The parts of Brep that lie inside (opposite the normal) of the cutter are retained while the parts to the outside ( in the direction of the normal ) are discarded. A connected component of Brep that does not intersect the cutter is kept if and only if it is contained in the inside of Cutter. That is the region bounded by cutter opposite from the normal of cutter, or in the case of a Plane cutter the half space opposite from the plane normal.
  BrepFace.RemoveHoles: Remove all inner loops, or holes, from a Brep face.
  BrepTrim.IsReversed: Get orientation of trim with respect to it's corresponding edge.
  Circle.Reverse: Reverse the orientation of the circle. Changes the domain from [a,b] to [-b,-a].
  Circle.Rotate: Rotates the circle around an axis that starts at the provided point.
  Circle.Rotate: Rotates the circle around an axis that starts at the base plane origin.
  Circle.Rotate: Rotates the circle through a given angle.
  Circle.Rotate: Rotates the circle through a given angle.
  Circle.Transform: Transforms this circle using an transformation matrix.
  Circle.Translate: Moves the circle.
  ClippingPlaneSurface.ClearClipParticipationLists: Remove list of object ids that this clipping plane surface clips. This causes the clipping plane surface to clip all objects
  ClippingPlaneSurface.RemoveClipViewportId: Removes a viewport id that this being clipped by this clipping plane.
  BrepEdgeList.RemoveNakedMicroEdges: Finds any naked edges with the same start and end vertex and an arc-length less than tolerance and attempts to remove them by removing trims and extending the adjacent to meet.
  BrepEdgeList.RemoveNakedMicroEdges: Finds any naked edges with the same start and end vertex and an arc-length less than tolerance and attempts to remove them by removing trims and extending the adjacent to meet.
  BrepFaceList.ClearPerFaceColors: Removes all per face color overrides on the active level.
  BrepFaceList.Flip: Flips the orientation of faces.
  BrepFaceList.RemoveAt: Deletes a face at a specified index.
  BrepFaceList.RemoveSlits: Remove slit trims and slit boundaries from each face.
  BrepFaceList.ShrinkFaces: Shrinks all the underlying surfaces in this Brep. Sometimes the surfaces extend far beyond the trimming boundaries of the Brep Face. This function will remove those portions of the surfaces that are not used.
  BrepFaceList.StandardizeFaceSurface: Standardizes the relationship between a BrepFace and the 3d surface it uses. When done, the face will be the only face that references its 3d surface, and the orientations of the face and 3d surface will be the same.
  MeshFaceList.CullDegenerateFaces: Attempts to removes degenerate faces from the mesh. Degenerate faces are faces that contains such a combination of indices, that their final shape collapsed in a line or point. Before returning, this method also attempts to repair faces by juggling vertex indices.
  MeshFaceList.DeleteFaces: Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  MeshFaceList.DeleteFaces: Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  MeshFaceList.ExtractDuplicateFaces: Extracts, or removes, duplicate faces.
  MeshFaceList.ExtractFaces: Extracts, or removes, faces.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveAt: Removes a face from the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveAt: Removes a face from the mesh.
  MeshFaceList.RemoveZeroAreaFaces: Deletes or fixes mesh faces that have zero area.
  MeshNgonList.Orientation: Determine if the ngon's boundary orientation matches that of the set of faces it is made from.
  MeshNgonList.RemoveAllNgons: Removes all ngons from the mesh.
  MeshNgonList.RemoveAt: Removes an ngon from the mesh.
  MeshNgonList.RemoveNgons: Remove one or more ngons from the mesh.
  MeshTextureCoordinateList.NormalizeTextureCoordinates: Scales the texture coordinates so the texture domains are [0,1] and eliminate any texture rotations.

If the lines are colinear, the point on the line closest to pointOnAngularDimensionArc is the center of the angular dimension arc.
  Arc.ClosestParameter: Gets parameter on the arc closest to a test point.
  Arc.ClosestPoint: Computes the point on an arc that is closest to a test point.

If the interval length exceeds 2.0 * Math.PI it will be clamped to exactly 2.0 * Math.PI. Returns True if the domain was set successfully, False otherwise.
  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Compute the AreaMassProperties for a single Brep.

  AreaMassProperties.Compute: Computes an AreaMassProperties for a surface.
  AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesPrincipalMoments: Calculates the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the moments matrix with respect to centroid coordinates.

  BoundingBox.ClosestPoint: Finds the closest point on or in the bounding box.
  BoundingBox.Contains: Determines whether this bounding box contains another bounding box. The user can choose how to treat bounding boxes with coincident surfaces.
  BoundingBox.Contains: Determines whether this bounding box contains another bounding box. This is the same as calling Contains(box,false).
  BoundingBox.Contains: Tests a point for BoundingBox inclusion.
  BoundingBox.Contains: Tests a point for bounding box inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(point, false)
  BoundingBox.PointAt: Evaluates the bounding box with normalized parameters. The box has idealized side length of 1x1x1.
  BoundingBox.Transform: Updates this bounding box to be the smallest axis aligned bounding box that contains the transformed result of its 8 original corner points.
  Box.ClosestPoint: Finds the closest point on or in the Box. The box should be Valid for this to work.
  Box.Contains: Test a bounding box for Box inclusion.
  Box.Contains: Test a bounding box for Box inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(box,false)
  Box.Contains: Test a box for Box inclusion.
  Box.Contains: Test a box for Box inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(box,false)
  Box.Contains: Determines whether a point is included in this box.
  Box.Contains: Determines whether a point is included in this box. This is the same as calling Contains(point,false)
  Box.PointAt: Evaluates the box volume at the given unitized parameters. The box has idealized side length of 1x1x1.
  Box.Union: Constructs a union between this Box and the given point. This grows the box in directions so it contains the point.
  Brep.CreateBooleanIntersection: Compute the Solid Intersection of two Breps.
  Brep.CreateBooleanIntersection: Compute the Solid Intersection of two Breps.
  Brep.CreateBooleanIntersection: Compute the Solid Intersection of two sets of Breps.
  Brep.CreateBooleanIntersection: Compute the Solid Intersection of two sets of Breps.
  Brep.CreateBooleanSplit: Splits shared areas of Breps and creates separate Breps from the shared and unshared parts.
  Brep.CreateBooleanSplit: Splits shared areas of Breps and creates separate Breps from the shared and unshared parts.
  Brep.CreateFromTaperedExtrudeWithRef: Creates one or more Breps by extruding a curve a distance along an axis with draft angle.
  Brep.CreatePlanarIntersection: CreatePlanarIntersection
  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.ClosestPoint: Finds a point on the Brep that is closest to testPoint. The method searches all Brep faces looking for the one closest to testPoint. When found, if the closest point falls on the inactive region of the face, then the method finds the face's edge that is closest to testPoint.

  Brep.CreateTrimmedSurface: Constructs a Brep using the trimming information of a brep face and a surface. Surface must be roughly the same shape and in the same location as the trimming brep face.

  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.MergeBreps: Combines two or more breps into one. A merge is like a boolean union that keeps the inside pieces. This function creates non-manifold Breps which in general are unusual in Rhino. You may want to consider using JoinBreps or CreateBooleanUnion functions instead.
  Brep.MergeSurfaces: Merges two surfaces into one surface at untrimmed edges. Both surfaces must be untrimmed and share an edge.

instruction: List all point and vector operations in RhinoCommon
code:
# RhinoCommon methods for points vectors:
  AngularDimension.Create: The angle between the lines is dimensioned. If the lines intersect in a single point, that point is used as the center of the angular dimension arc.In this case, there are eight possible angles to dimension.The pointOnAngularDimensionArc and pointOnLine parameters are used to select the correct angle to dimension. If a pointOnLine parameter is not set, the corresponding line's midpoint is used. If the lines are colinear, the point on the line closest to pointOnAngularDimensionArc is the center of the angular dimension arc.
  AngularDimension.Create: Creates an angular dimension with extension lines starting at plane origin (arc center).
  AngularDimension.AdjustFromPoints: Update angular dimension from point locations.
  AngularDimension.AdjustFromPoints: Updates dimension geometry from point locations.
  AngularDimension.Get3dPoints: Get locations of dimension's 3d points
  Arc.ClosestParameter: Gets parameter on the arc closest to a test point.
  Arc.ClosestPoint: Computes the point on an arc that is closest to a test point.
  Arc.PointAt: Gets the point at the given arc parameter.
  AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesPrincipalMoments: Calculates the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the moments matrix with respect to centroid coordinates.
  AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesPrincipalMomentsOfInertia: Calculates the principal moments of inertia and principal axes with respect to centroid coordinates.
  AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesPrincipalMoments: Calculates the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of moments matrix in world coordinates.
  AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesPrincipalMomentsOfInertia: Calculates the principal moments of inertia and principal axes with respect to world coordinates.
  BezierCurve.CreateLoftedBezier: Loft a bezier through a list of points
  BezierCurve.CreateLoftedBezier: Loft a bezier through a list of points

  BezierCurve.PointAt: Evaluates point at a curve parameter.
  BezierCurve.TangentAt: Evaluates the unit tangent vector at a curve parameter.
  BezierSurface.PointAt: Evaluates point at a surface parameter.
  BoundingBox.Union: Returns a new BoundingBox that represents the union of a bounding box and a point.
  BoundingBox.ClosestPoint: Finds the closest point on or in the bounding box.
  BoundingBox.ClosestPoint: Finds the closest point on or in the bounding box.
  BoundingBox.Contains: Tests a point for BoundingBox inclusion.
  BoundingBox.Contains: Tests a point for bounding box inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(point, false)
  BoundingBox.FurthestPoint: Finds the furthest point on the Box.
  BoundingBox.GetCorners: Gets an array filled with the 8 corner points of this box. See remarks for the return order.
  BoundingBox.MakeValid: Ensures that the box is defined in an increasing fashion along X, Y and Z axes. If the Min or Max points are unset, this function will not change the box.
  BoundingBox.PointAt: Evaluates the bounding box with normalized parameters. The box has idealized side length of 1x1x1.
  BoundingBox.Transform: Updates this bounding box to be the smallest axis aligned bounding box that contains the transformed result of its 8 original corner points.
  BoundingBox.Union: Updates this BoundingBox to represent the union of itself and a point.
  Box.ClosestPoint: Finds the closest point on or in the Box. The box should be Valid for this to work.
  Box.Contains: Determines whether a point is included in this box.
  Box.Contains: Determines whether a point is included in this box. This is the same as calling Contains(point,false)
  Box.FurthestPoint: Finds the furthest point on the Box. The Box should be Valid for this to work properly.

  Box.PointAt: Evaluates the box volume at the given unitized parameters. The box has idealized side length of 1x1x1.
  Box.RepositionBasePlane: Repositions the origin of the Base plane for this box without affecting the physical dimensions.
  Box.Union: Constructs a union between this Box and the given point. This grows the box in directions so it contains the point.
  Brep.CreateBlendShape: Makes a curve blend between points on two surface edges. The blend will be tangent to the surfaces and perpendicular to the edges.
  Brep.CreateContourCurves: Constructs the contour curves for a brep, using a slicing plane.
  Brep.CreateFromBox: Constructs new brep from 8 corner points.
  Brep.CreateFromCornerPoints: Makes a Brep with one face from four corner points.
  Brep.CreateFromCornerPoints: Makes a Brep with one face from three corner points.
  Brep.CreateFromLoftRebuild: Constructs one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by rebuilding to a specified number of control points.
  Brep.CreateFromLoftRebuild: Constructs one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by rebuilding to a specified number of control points.
  Brep.CreatePatch: Constructs a brep patch. This is the simple version of fit that uses a plane with u x v spans. It makes a plane by fitting to the points from the input geometry to use as the starting surface. The surface has the specified u and v span count.
  Brep.CreateTrimmedPlane: Create a Brep trimmed plane.
  Brep.CreateTrimmedPlane: Create a Brep trimmed plane.
  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.ExtendBrepFacesToConnect: Extends Faces to meet and trims the faces to each other. If input faces intersect without extending, the selection point indicates the side to keep
  Brep.ClosestPoint: Finds a point on the Brep that is closest to testPoint. The method searches all Brep faces looking for the one closest to testPoint. When found, if the closest point falls on the inactive region of the face, then the method finds the face's edge that is closest to testPoint.

# Rhino.Geometry.Arc methods:
  - BoundingBox(): Computes the 3D axis aligned bounding box for this arc.

  - Equals(other): Determines whether another arc has the same value as this arc.
  - Equals(obj): Determines whether another object is an arc and has the same value as this arc.
  - GetHashCode(): Computes a hash code for the present arc.
  - PointAt(t): Gets the point at the given arc parameter.

  - TangentAt(t): Gets the tangent at the given parameter.
  - ToNurbsCurve(): Initializes a nurbs curve representation of this arc. This amounts to the same as calling NurbsCurve.CreateFromArc().
  - ToNurbsCurve(degree, cvCount): Create a uniform non-rational cubic NURBS approximation of an arc.
  - Transform(xform): Transforms the arc using a Transformation matrix.
  - Trim(domain): Sets the arc's angle domain (in radians) to the specified interval, provided it is increasing and its length does not exceed 2.0 * Math.PI (plus a small tolerance). If the interval length exceeds 2.0 * Math.PI it will be clamped to exactly 2.0 * Math.PI. Returns True if the domain was set successfully, False otherwise.

  - AdjacentFaces(): Gets the indices of all the BrepFaces that surround (are adjacent to) this face.
  - ChangeSurface(surfaceIndex): Expert user tool that replaces the 3d surface geometry use by the face.
  - ClearMaterialChannelIndex(): Clear this face's rendering material channel index.
  - ClearPackId(): Sets BrepFace.PackId to 0.
  - CreateExtrusion(pathCurve, cap): Extrude a face in a Brep.
  - DraftAnglePoint(testPoint, testAngle, pullDirection, edge, draftPoint, draftAngle): Returns the surface draft angle and point at a parameter.
  - DuplicateFace(duplicateMeshes): Duplicate a face from the brep to create new single face brep.
  - DuplicateSurface(): Gets a copy to the untrimmed surface that this face is based on.
  - FilletSurfaceToCurve(curve, t, u, v, radius, alignToCurve, railDegree, arcDegree, arcSliders, numBezierSrfs, tolerance, out_fillets, fitResults): Creates a constant-radius fillet surface between a surface and the curve.
  - FilletSurfaceToRail(curveOnFace, secondFace, u1, v1, railDegree, arcDegree, arcSliders, numBezierSrfs, extend, split_type, tolerance, out_fillets, out_breps0, out_breps1, fitResults): Creates a surface between two surfaces, with a fixed rail curve on the first surface.
  - GetMesh(meshType): Obtains a reference to a specified type of mesh for this brep face.
  - IsPointOnFace(u, v, tolerance): Tests if a parameter space point is in the active region of a face.
  - IsPointOnFace(u, v): Tests if a parameter space point is in the active region of a face.
  - PullPointsToFace(points, tolerance): Pulls one or more points to a brep face.
  - RebuildEdges(tolerance, rebuildSharedEdges, rebuildVertices): Rebuild the edges used by a face so they lie on the surface.
  - RefitTrim(edge, knots, tolerance, bSections, fitQuality): The RefitTrim command replaces a trimmed surface edge with an untrimmed edge.
  - RemoveHoles(tolerance): Remove all inner loops, or holes, from a Brep face.
  - SetDomain(direction, domain): Sets the surface domain of this face.
  - SetMesh(meshType, mesh): Sets a reference to a specified type of mesh for this brep face.
  - SetPackId(packId): Used by SubD functions that create breps to transmit the subd face SubDFace.PackId value to the brep face or faces generated from the subd face. Unless you are an expert and doing something very carefully and very fancy, to not call this function.
  - ShrinkFace(disableSide): Shrinks the underlying untrimmed surface of this Brep face close to trimming boundaries. Shrinking a surface is like extending smoothly, only backwards. knot of full multiplicity are added where you want the surface to be cut off. Then the remaining control points are thrown away.
  - ShrinkSurfaceToEdge(): Shrinks the underlying untrimmed surface of this Brep face right to the trimming boundaries. Note, shrinking the trimmed surface can sometimes cause problems later since having the edges so close to the trimming boundaries can cause commands that use the surface edges as input to fail.
  - Split(curves, tolerance): Split this face using 3D trimming curves.
  - TrimAwareIsoCurve(direction, constantParameter): Similar to IsoCurve function, except this function pays attention to trims on faces and may return multiple curves.
  - TrimAwareIsoIntervals(direction, constantParameter): Gets intervals where the iso curve exists on a BrepFace (trimmed surface)
  - UnderlyingSurface(): Gets the untrimmed surface that is the base of this face.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon Circle?

# Rhino.Geometry.Circle methods:
  - TryFitCircleToPoints(points, circle): Attempt to fit a circle through a set of points.

  - TryFitCircleTTT(c1, c2, c3, t1, t2, t3): Try to fit a circle to three curves using tangent relationships.

  - ClosestPoint(testPoint): Gets the point on the circle which is closest to a test point.

  - EpsilonEquals(other, epsilon): Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this
  - IsInPlane(plane, tolerance): Evaluates whether or not this circle is co-planar with a given plane.
  - PointAt(t): Circles use trigonometric parameterization: t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis.
  - Reverse(): Reverse the orientation of the circle. Changes the domain from [a,b] to [-b,-a].
  - Rotate(sinAngle, cosAngle, axis, point): Rotates the circle around an axis that starts at the provided point.

  - Rotate(angle, axis): Rotates the circle through a given angle.
  - TangentAt(t): Circles use trigonometric parameterization: t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis.
  - ToNurbsCurve(): Constructs a nurbs curve representation of this circle. This amounts to the same as calling NurbsCurve.CreateFromCircle().
  - ToNurbsCurve(degree, cvCount): Create a uniform non-rational cubic NURBS approximation of a circle.
  - Transform(xform): Transforms this circle using an transformation matrix.
  - Translate(delta): Moves the circle.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon BrepEdgeList?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepEdgeList methods:
  - Add(startVertex, endVertex, curve3dIndex, subDomain, edgeTolerance): Create and add a new edge to this list
  - Add(startVertex, endVertex, curve3dIndex, edgeTolerance): Create and add a new edge to this list
  - Add(startVertexIndex, endVertexIndex, curve3dIndex, subDomain, edgeTolerance): Create and add a new edge to this list
  - Add(startVertexIndex, endVertexIndex, curve3dIndex, edgeTolerance): Create and add a new edge to this list

  - GetEnumerator(): Gets an enumerator that visits all edges.
  - MergeAllEdges(angleTolerance): Merges all possible Brep edges. Edges across kinks cannot be merged. A pair of adjacent edges in a Brep are mergeable if the angle between them is less than tolerance and the valence of the shared vertex is 2.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon BrepFaceList?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList methods:
  - Add(surface): Add a new face to a brep. This creates a complete face with new vertices at the surface corners, new edges along the surface boundary, etc. The loop of the returned face has four trims that correspond to the south, east, north, and west side of the surface in that order. If you use this version of Add to add an exiting brep, then you are responsible for using a tool like JoinEdges() to hook the new face to its neighbors.
  - Add(surfaceIndex): Create and add a new face to this list. An incomplete face is added. The caller must create and fill in the loops used by the face.
  - AddConeFace(vertex, edge, revEdge): Add a new face to the brep whose surface geometry is a ruled cone with the edge as the base and the vertex as the apex point.
  - AddRuledFace(edgeA, revEdgeA, edgeB, revEdgeB): Add a new face to the brep whose surface geometry is a ruled surface between two edges.
  - ClearPerFaceColors(): Removes all per face color overrides on the active level.
  - ExtractFace(faceIndex): Extracts a face from a Brep.
  - Flip(onlyReversedFaces): Flips the orientation of faces.
  - GetEnumerator(): Gets an enumerators that yields BrepFace objects.
  - RemoveAt(faceIndex): Deletes a face at a specified index.
  - RemoveSlits(): Remove slit trims and slit boundaries from each face.
  - ShrinkFaces(): Shrinks all the underlying surfaces in this Brep. Sometimes the surfaces extend far beyond the trimming boundaries of the Brep Face. This function will remove those portions of the surfaces that are not used.
  - SplitBipolarFaces(): Splits surfaces with two singularities, like spheres, so the results have at most one singularity.
  - SplitClosedFaces(minimumDegree): Splits closed surfaces so they are not closed.
  - SplitFaceAtTangents(faceIndex): Splits the face of a Brep at tangent locations.
  - SplitFacesAtTangents(): Splits all of the faces of a Brep at tangent locations.
  - SplitKinkyFace(faceIndex, kinkTolerance): Splits a single face into G1 pieces.
  - SplitKinkyFaces(): Splits any faces with creases into G1 pieces.
  - SplitKinkyFaces(kinkTolerance, compact): Splits any faces with creases into G1 pieces.
  - SplitKinkyFaces(kinkTolerance): Splits any faces with creases into G1 pieces.
  - StandardizeFaceSurface(faceIndex): Standardizes the relationship between a BrepFace and the 3d surface it uses. When done, the face will be the only face that references its 3d surface, and the orientations of the face and 3d surface will be the same.
  - StandardizeFaceSurfaces(): Standardize all faces in the brep.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon BrepLoopList?

# Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList methods:

  - GetEnumerator(): Gets an enumerator that visits all edges.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon MeshFaceList?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList methods:
  - AddFace(face): Appends a new mesh face to the end of the mesh face list.
  - AddFace(vertex1, vertex2, vertex3, vertex4): Appends a new quadrangular face to the end of the mesh face list.
  - AddFace(vertex1, vertex2, vertex3): Appends a new triangular face to the end of the mesh face list.
  - AddFaces(faces): Appends a list of faces to the end of the mesh face list.
  - AdjacentFaces(faceIndex): Gets all faces that share a topological edge with a given face.
  - Clear(): Clears the Face list on the mesh.
  - ConvertNonPlanarQuadsToTriangles(planarTolerance, angleToleranceRadians, splitMethod): Splits non-planar quads into two triangles based on given parameters.
  - ConvertQuadsToTriangles(): Splits all quads along the short diagonal.
  - ConvertTrianglesToQuads(angleToleranceRadians, minimumDiagonalLengthRatio): Joins adjacent triangles into quads if the resulting quad is 'nice'.
  - CullDegenerateFaces(): Attempts to removes degenerate faces from the mesh. Degenerate faces are faces that contains such a combination of indices, that their final shape collapsed in a line or point. Before returning, this method also attempts to repair faces by juggling vertex indices.
  - DeleteFaces(faceIndexes, compact): Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  - DeleteFaces(faceIndexes): Removes a collection of faces from the mesh without affecting the remaining geometry.
  - Destroy(): Releases all memory allocated to store faces. The list capacity will be 0 after this call. Subsequent calls can add new items.
  - ExtractDuplicateFaces(): Extracts, or removes, duplicate faces.
  - ExtractFaces(faceIndices): Extracts, or removes, faces.
  - GetClashingFacePairs(maxPairCount): Gets an array of pairs of mesh faces that clash.
  - GetConnectedFaces(faceIndex, angleRadians, greaterThanAngle): Find all connected face indices where adjacent face normals meet the criteria of angleRadians and greaterThanAngle
  - GetConnectedFaces(faceIndex): Find all connected face indices
  - GetConnectedFacesToEdges(startFaceIndex, treatNonmanifoldLikeUnwelded): Uses startFaceIndex and finds all connected face indexes up to unwelded or naked edges. If treatNonmanifoldLikeUnwelded is True then non-manifold edges will be considered as unwelded or naked
  - GetDuplicateFaces(): Finds all of the duplicate faces.
  - GetEnumerator(): Gets an enumerator that yields all faces in this collection.
  - GetFace(index): Returns the mesh face at the given index.
  - GetFaceAspectRatio(index): Returns the mesh face at the given index.
  - GetFaceBoundingBox(faceIndex): Gets the bounding box of a face.
  - GetFaceCenter(faceIndex): Gets the center point of a face. For a triangular face, this is the centroid or barycenter. For a quad, this is the average of four comer points.
  - GetFaceVertices(faceIndex, a, b, c, d): Gets the 3D location of the vertices forming a face.
  - GetTopologicalVertices(faceIndex): Gets the topology vertex indices of a face.
  - GetZeroAreaFaces(whollyDegenerateFaces, partiallyDegenerateFaces): Examines and adds face indexes to whollyDegenerateFaces if the face is a triangle with zero area or a quad both triangles have zero area. Face indexes are added to partiallyDegenerateFaces when a quad has one triangle with zero area.
  - HasNakedEdges(faceIndex): Returns True if at least one of the face edges are not topologically connected to any other faces.
  - Insert(index, face): Inserts a mesh face at a defined index in this list.

If [index] equals [Count], a new coordinate is appended to the end of the coordinate list. If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon GeometryBase?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase methods:
  - GeometryEquals(first, second): Determines if two geometries equal one another, in pure geometrical shape. This version only compares the geometry itself and does not include any user data comparisons. This is a comparison by value: for two identical items it will be true, no matter where in memory they may be stored.
  - GeometryReferenceEquals(one, other): Determines if two objects are respectively shallow copies, new managed instantiations of the same geometry, or similar internal references to the exact same geometry, both in managed and in unmanaged code.
  - ComponentIndex(): If this piece of geometry is a component in something larger, like a BrepEdge in a Brep, then this function returns the component index.
  - DataCRC(currentRemainder): Returns a CRC calculated from the information that defines the object. This CRC can be used as a quick way to see if two objects are not identical.
  - DeleteAllUserStrings(): 
  - DeleteUserString(key): 
  - Duplicate(): Constructs a deep (full) copy of this object.
  - DuplicateShallow(): Constructs a light copy of this object. By "light", it is meant that the same underlying data is used until something is done to attempt to change it. For example, you could have a shallow copy of a very heavy mesh object and the same underlying data will be used when doing things like inspecting the number of faces on the mesh. If you modify the location of one of the mesh vertices, the shallow copy will create a full duplicate of the underlying mesh data and the shallow copy will become a deep copy.
  - GetBoundingBox(plane, worldBox): Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the plane aligned bounding box.
  - GetBoundingBox(plane): Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the plane aligned bounding box.
  - GetBoundingBox(accurate): Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the geometry.
  - GetBoundingBox(xform): Aligned Bounding box solver. Gets the world axis aligned bounding box for the transformed geometry.
  - GetUserString(key): Gets user string from this geometry.
  - GetUserStrings(): Gets a copy of all (user key string, user value string) pairs attached to this geometry.
  - MakeDeformable(): If possible, converts the object into a form that can be accurately modified with "squishy" transformations like projections, shears, an non-uniform scaling.
  - MemoryEstimate(): Computes an estimate of the number of bytes that this object is using in memory.
  - Rotate(angleRadians, rotationAxis, rotationCenter): Rotates the object about the specified axis. A positive rotation angle results in a counter-clockwise rotation about the axis (right hand rule).
  - Scale(scaleFactor): Scales the object by the specified factor. The scale is centered at the origin.
  - SetUserString(key, value): Attach a user string (key,value combination) to this geometry.
  - Transform(xform): Transforms the geometry. If the input Transform has a SimilarityType of OrientationReversing, you may want to consider flipping the transformed geometry after calling this function when it makes sense. For example, you may want to call Flip() on a Brep after transforming it.
  - Translate(x, y, z): Translates the object along the specified vector.
  - Translate(translationVector): Translates the object along the specified vector.

The viewport supplies the projection that determines the visibility of curves, and the HLD coordinate system in which the resulting curves are represented. The HLD-coordinate system is a right handed system for 3-D model space, in which the 3rd coordinate direction is the projection direction. In particular the z-coordinate direction points from the scene toward the camera.

This function returns the 3D points of intersection, curve parameters at the intersection locations, and 3D overlap curves. If an error occurs while processing overlap curves, this function will return false, but it will still provide partial results.
  - CurveBrep(curve, brep, tolerance, overlapCurves, intersectionPoints): Intersects a curve with a Brep. This function returns the 3D points of intersection and 3D overlap curves. If an error occurs while processing overlap curves, this function will return false, but it will still provide partial results.

  - CurveLine(curve, line, tolerance, overlapTolerance): Intersects a curve and an infinite line.

  - CurveSelf(curve, tolerance): Finds the places where a curve intersects itself.
  - CurveSurface(curve, curveDomain, surface, tolerance, overlapTolerance): Intersects a sub-curve and a surface.
  - CurveSurface(curve, surface, tolerance, overlapTolerance): Intersects a curve and a surface.
  - CurveSurfaceValidate(curve, curveDomain, surface, tolerance, overlapTolerance, invalidIndices, textLog): Intersects a sub-curve and a surface.
  - CurveSurfaceValidate(curve, surface, tolerance, overlapTolerance, invalidIndices, textLog): Intersects a curve and a surface.
  - LineBox(line, box, tolerance, lineParameters): Intersects an infinite line and an axis aligned bounding box.

  - LinePlane(line, plane, lineParameter): Intersects a line and a plane. This function only returns True if the intersection result is a single point (i.e. if the line is coincident with the plane then no intersection is assumed).
  - LineSphere(line, sphere, intersectionPoint1, intersectionPoint2): Intersects a line with a sphere using exact calculations.

  - GetHashCode(): Gets the hash code for this matrix. The hash code will change when the matrix changes so you cannot change matrices while they are stored in hash tables.
  - Invert(zeroTolerance): Modifies this matrix to become its own inverse. Matrix might be non-invertible (singular) and the return value will be false.
  - RowReduce(zeroTolerance, determinant, pivot): Row reduces a matrix to calculate rank and determinant.
  - RowReduce(zeroTolerance, b, pivot): Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of 3d points.
  - RowReduce(zeroTolerance, b, pivot): Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of values.
  - Scale(s): Modifies the current matrix by multiplying its values by a number.
  - SetDiagonal(d): Sets diagonal value and zeros off all non-diagonal values.
  - SwapColumns(columnA, columnB): Exchanges two columns.
  - SwapRows(rowA, rowB): Exchanges two rows.
  - Transpose(): Modifies this matrix to be its transpose. This is like swapping rows with columns. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transpose
  - Zero(): Sets all values inside the matrix to zero.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon MeshFace?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace methods:
  - CompareTo(other): Compares this MeshFace with another MeshFace and returns a value of 1, 0, or -1, referring to dictionary order. Index evaluation priority is first A, then B, then C, then D.
  - Equals(other): Returns a value indicating whether the other mesh face has precisely the same value as the current one.
  - Equals(obj): Returns a value indicating whether the other object obj has precisely the same value as the current one.
  - Flip(): Reverses the orientation of the face by swapping corners. The first corner is always maintained.
  - GetHashCode(): Returns a runtime-stable hash code for the current mesh face. You are not allowed to rely on persistence of this hash code in serialization, but for each version of RhinoCommon, this hash code will be the same for each mesh face.
  - IsValid(): Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Note that even valid mesh faces could potentially be invalid in the context of a specific Mesh, if one or more of the corner indices exceeds the number of vertices on the mesh. If you want to perform a complete validity check, use IsValid(int) instead.
  - IsValid(points): Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
  - IsValid(vertexCount): Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes upper bound indices into account.
  - IsValidEx(points): Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
  - Repair(points): Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
  - RepairEx(points): Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
  - Set(a, b, c, d): Sets all the corners for this face as a quad.
  - Set(a, b, c): Sets all the corners for this face as a triangle.
  - ToString(): Returns a string representation for this MeshFace . This is to provide a meaningful visualization of this structure and is subject to change in newer releases.

# Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon methods:
  - Create(meshVertexIndexList, meshFaceIndexList): Constructs an ngon from lists of mesh vertex and face indexes.

  - Set(meshVertexIndexList, meshFaceIndexList): Set the ngon vertex and face index lists.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon NurbsCurve?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve methods:
  - Create(periodic, degree, points): Constructs a 3D NURBS curve from a list of control points.
  - CreateFromArc(arc, degree, cvCount): Create a uniform non-rational cubic NURBS approximation of an arc.
  - CreateFromArc(arc): Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the arc. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match arc's transcendental parameterization.
  - CreateFromCircle(circle, degree, cvCount): Create a uniform non-rational cubic NURBS approximation of a circle.
  - CreateFromCircle(circle): Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the circle. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match circle's transcendental parameterization. Use GetRadianFromNurbFormParameter() and GetParameterFromRadian() to convert between the NURBS curve parameter and the transcendental parameter.
  - CreateFromEllipse(ellipse): Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the ellipse. Note that the parameterization of the NURBS curve does not match with the transcendental parameterization of the ellipsis.
  - CreateFromFitPoints(points, tolerance, periodic): Fits a NURBS curve to a dense, ordered set of points.
  - CreateFromFitPoints(points, tolerance, degree, periodic, startTangent, endTangent): Fits a NURBS curve to a dense, ordered set of points.
  - CreateFromLine(line): Gets a non-rational, degree 1 NURBS curve representation of the line.
  - CreateHSpline(points, startTangent, endTangent): Construct an H-spline from a sequence of interpolation points and optional start and end derivative information
  - CreateHSpline(points): Construct an H-spline from a sequence of interpolation points
  - CreateNonRationalArcBezier(degree, center, start, end, radius, tanSlider, midSlider): Creates a non-rational approximation of a rational arc as a single bezier segment
  - CreateParabolaFromFocus(focus, startPoint, endPoint): Creates a parabola from focus and end points.
  - CreateParabolaFromPoints(startPoint, innerPoint, endPoint): Creates a parabola from three points.
  - CreateParabolaFromVertex(vertex, startPoint, endPoint): Creates a parabola from vertex and end points.
  - CreateSpiral(railCurve, t0, t1, radiusPoint, pitch, turnCount, radius0, radius1, pointsPerTurn): Create a C2 non-rational uniform cubic NURBS approximation of a swept helix or spiral.
  - CreateSpiral(axisStart, axisDir, radiusPoint, pitch, turnCount, radius0, radius1): Creates a C1 cubic NURBS approximation of a helix or spiral. For a helix, you may have radius0 == radius1. For a spiral radius0 == radius1 produces a circle. Zero and negative radii are permissible.
  - CreateSubDFriendly(curve, pointCount, periodicClosedCurve): Create a NURBS curve, that is suitable for calculations like lofting SubD objects, from an existing curve.
  - CreateSubDFriendly(curve): Create a NURBS curve, that is suitable for calculations like lofting SubD objects, from an existing curve.
  - CreateSubDFriendly(points, interpolatePoints, periodicClosedCurve): Create a NURBS curve, that is suitable for calculations like lofting SubD objects, through a sequence of curves.
  - IsDuplicate(curveA, curveB, ignoreParameterization, tolerance): Determines if two curves are similar.
  - MakeCompatible(curves, startPt, endPt, simplifyMethod, numPoints, refitTolerance, angleTolerance): For expert use only. From the input curves, make an array of compatible NURBS curves.
  - Append(nurbsCurve): Appends a NURBS curve to this curve.
  - ConvertSpanToBezier(spanIndex): Converts a span of the NURBS curve into a Bezier.
  - CreatePlanarRailFrames(parameters, normal): Computes planar rail sweep frames at specified parameters.
  - CreateRailFrames(parameters): Computes relatively parallel rail sweep frames at specified parameters.
  - EpsilonEquals(other, epsilon): Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this
  - GrevilleParameter(index): Gets the greville (edit point) parameter that belongs to the control point at the specified index.
  - GrevilleParameters(): Gets all Greville parameters for this curve.
  - GrevillePoint(index): Gets the Greville parameter that belongs to the control point at the specified index.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon NurbsSurface?

# Rhino.Geometry.NurbsSurface methods:
  - Create(dimension, isRational, order0, order1, controlPointCount0, controlPointCount1): Constructs a new NURBS surface with internal uninitialized arrays.
  - CreateCurveOnSurface(surface, points, tolerance, periodic): Fit a sequence of 2d points on a surface to make a curve on the surface.
  - CreateCurveOnSurfacePoints(surface, fixedPoints, tolerance, periodic, initCount, levels): Computes a discrete spline curve on the surface. In other words, computes a sequence of points on the surface, each with a corresponding parameter value.
  - CreateFromCone(cone): Constructs a new NURBS surfaces from cone data.
  - CreateFromCorners(corner1, corner2, corner3, corner4, tolerance): Makes a surface from 4 corner points.
  - CreateFromCorners(corner1, corner2, corner3, corner4): Makes a surface from 4 corner points. This is the same as calling with tolerance 0.
  - CreateFromCorners(corner1, corner2, corner3): Makes a surface from 3 corner points.
  - CreateFromCylinder(cylinder): Constructs a new NURBS surfaces from cylinder data.
  - CreateFromPlane(plane, uInterval, vInterval, uDegree, vDegree, uPointCount, vPointCount): Creates a NURBS surface from a plane and additional parameters.
  - CreateFromPoints(points, uCount, vCount, uDegree, vDegree): Constructs a NURBS surface from a 2D grid of control points.
  - CreateFromSphere(sphere): Constructs a new NURBS surfaces from sphere data.
  - CreateFromTorus(torus): Constructs a new NURBS surfaces from torus data.
  - CreateNetworkSurface(curves, continuity, edgeTolerance, interiorTolerance, angleTolerance, error): Builds a surface from an auto-sorted network of curves/edges.
  - CreateNetworkSurface(uCurves, uContinuityStart, uContinuityEnd, vCurves, vContinuityStart, vContinuityEnd, edgeTolerance, interiorTolerance, angleTolerance, error): Builds a surface from an ordered network of curves/edges.
  - CreateRailRevolvedSurface(profile, rail, axis, scaleHeight): Constructs a railed Surface-of-Revolution.
  - CreateRuledSurface(curveA, curveB): Constructs a ruled surface between two curves. Curves must share the same knot-vector.
  - CreateSubDFriendly(surface): Create a bi-cubic SubD friendly surface from a surface.
  - CreateThroughPoints(points, uCount, vCount, uDegree, vDegree, uClosed, vClosed): Constructs a NURBS surface from a 2D grid of points.
  - MakeCompatible(surface0, surface1, nurb0, nurb1): For expert use only. Makes a pair of compatible NURBS surfaces based on two input surfaces.
  - ConvertSpanToBezier(spanIndex0, spanIndex1): Convert a NURBS surface bispan into a Bezier surface.
  - CopyFrom(other): Copies this NURBS surface from another NURBS surface.
  - EpsilonEquals(other, epsilon): Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this
  - FindClosestIsoCurve(testPoint): Find the closest isoparamentric curve, given a test point.
  - IncreaseDegreeU(desiredDegree): Increase the degree of this surface in U direction.
  - IncreaseDegreeV(desiredDegree): Increase the degree of this surface in V direction.
  - MakeNonRational(): Makes this surface non-rational.
  - MakeRational(): Makes this surface rational.
  - MakeUniform(direction): Changes a NURBS surface so each control point affects the surface exactly the same way. This make the knot vectors uniform without changing the control point locations. This will change the object shape slightly.
  - MatchToCurve(side, targetCurve, maxEndDistance, maxInteriorDistance, matchTolerance, maxLevel): Constructs a NURBS surface with start and end edge isocurve matching the start and end of targetCurve, and Greville points on targetCurve.
  - UVNDirectionsAt(u, v, uDir, vDir, nDir): Calculates the U, V, and N directions of a NURBS surface at a u,v parameter similar to the method used by Rhino's MoveUVN command.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon PolyCurve?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve methods:
  - Append(arc): Appends and matches the start of the arc to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the arc is closed.
  - Append(curve): Appends and matches the start of the curve to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
  - Append(line): Appends and matches the start of the line to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed.
  - AppendSegment(curve): Appends the curve to the polycurve without changing the new segment's geometry. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
  - CleanUp(): Removes any nesting of polycurves. If this polycurve has just a single segment, the segment is returned. If, after nest removal, there are adjacent segments which are polylines, they are combined into a single polyline. The new curve may have a different domain from this polycurve. If the start and end segments of a closed input are polylines, the result may have a different seam location since the start and end segments will be combined.
  - Duplicate(): Duplicates this polycurve. When not overridden in a derived class, this calls .
  - DuplicatePolyCurve(): Duplicates this polycurve. This is the same as .
  - Explode(): Explodes this PolyCurve into a list of Curve segments. This willnot explodenested polycurves. Call RemoveNesting first if you need all individual segments.
  - PolyCurveParameter(segmentIndex, segmentCurveParameter): Converts a segment curve parameter to a polycurve parameter.
  - RemoveNesting(): Explodes nested polycurve segments and reconstructs this curve from the shattered remains. The result will have not have any PolyCurves as segments but it will have identical locus and parameterization.
  - SegmentCurve(index): Gets the segment curve at the given index.
  - SegmentCurveParameter(polycurveParameter): Converts a polycurve parameter to a segment curve parameter.
  - SegmentDomain(segmentIndex): Returns the polycurve sub-domain assigned to a segment curve.
  - SegmentIndex(polycurveParameter): Finds the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter.
  - SegmentIndexes(subdomain, segmentIndex0, segmentIndex1): Finds the segments that overlap the Polycurve sub domain.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon Polyline?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.Polyline methods:
  - CreateByJoiningLines(lines, tolerance, splitAtIntersections): Creates polylines by joining lines.
  - CreateCircumscribedPolygon(circle, sideCount): Create a regular polygon circumscribe about a circle. The midpoints of the polygon's edges will be tangent to the circle.
  - CreateInscribedPolygon(circle, sideCount): Create a regular polygon inscribed in a circle. The vertices of the polygon will be on the circle.
  - CreateStarPolygon(circle, radius, cornerCount): Create a regular star polygon. The star begins at circle.PointAt(0) and the vertices alternate between being on circle and begin on a concentric circle of other_radius.
  - BreakAtAngles(angle): Breaks this polyline into sections at sharp kinks. Closed polylines will also be broken at the first and last vertex.
  - CenterPoint(): Compute the center point of the polyline as the weighted average of all segments.
  - ClosestParameter(testPoint): Gets the parameter along the polyline which is closest to a test-point.
  - ClosestPoint(testPoint): Gets the point on the polyline which is closest to a test-point.
  - CollapseShortSegments(tolerance): Collapses all segments until none are shorter than tolerance. This function is significantly slower than DeleteShortSegments, since it recursively operates on the shortest segment. When a segment is collapsed the end-points are placed in the center of the segment.
  - DeleteShortSegments(tolerance): Removes all points that are closer than tolerance to the previous point. Start and end points are left intact.
  - Duplicate(): Returns a deep copy of this polyline instance.
  - GetSegments(): Constructs an array of line segments that make up the entire polyline.
  - IsClosedWithinTolerance(tolerance): Test a polyline to see if it is closed.
  - IsConvexLoop(strictlyConvex): Determines if a polyline is convex.
  - MergeColinearSegments(angleTolerance, includeSeam): Merge co-linear consecutive segments in a polyline. This method will automatically remove any zero-length segments as well.
  - PointAt(t): Gets the point on the polyline at the given parameter. The integer part of the parameter indicates the index of the segment.
  - ReduceSegments(tolerance): Constructs a reduction of this polyline by recursively removing the least significant segments.
  - RemoveNearlyEqualSubsequentPoints(tolerance): Removes one copy of a point that is equal to the previous or later point, by an absolute tolerance factor.
  - SegmentAt(index): Gets the line segment at the given index.
  - Smooth(amount): Smoothen the polyline segments by averaging adjacent vertices. Smoothing requires a polyline with exclusively valid vertices.
  - TangentAt(t): Gets the unit tangent vector along the polyline at the given parameter. The integer part of the parameter indicates the index of the segment.
  - ToNurbsCurve(): Constructs a nurbs curve representation of this polyline.
  - ToPolylineCurve(): Constructs a polyline curve representation of this polyline.
  - TriangulateClosedPolyline(): Attempts to create a list of triangles which represent a triangulation of a closed polyline
  - Trim(domain): Constructs a polyline out of a parameter sub-domain in this curve.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon PolylineCurve?

# Rhino.Geometry.PolylineCurve methods:
  - CreateConvexHull2d(points, hullIndices): Attempts to create a closed PolylineCurve that is the anti-clockwise planar convex hull of the input points. In addition, the indices of the extremal points among the input points are returned in correct order. Possible duplicates among the input points are taken care of. The input pointsThe indices into the input points such that points[hullIndices[i]] = result[i]. Since the result is a closed polyline if successful, the start/end index is repeated at the beginning and end of the hullIndices. The closed PolylineCurve encompassing the input points, or None if the input points were either too few, or were found to be collinear.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon Quaternion?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion methods:
  - CreateFromRotationZYX(yaw, pitch, roll): Constructs a quaternion defined by Tait-Byran angles, also loosely known as Euler angles.
  - CreateFromRotationZYZ(alpha, beta, gamma): Constructs a quaternion defined by Euler angles.
  - CrossProduct(p, q): Computes the vector cross product of p and q = (0,x,y,z), where (x,y,z) = CrossProduct(p.Vector,q.Vector). This is not the same as the quaternion product p*q.
  - Distance(p, q): Returns the distance or norm of the difference between two quaternions.
  - Lerp(a, b, t): Interpolates between two quaternions, using linear interpolation.
  - Product(p, q): The quaternion product of p and q. This is the same value as p*q.
  - RotateTowards(a, b, maxRadians): Returns the quaternion obtained by rotating a towards b, limiting the rotation by MaxRadians.
  - Rotation(plane0, plane1): Returns the unit quaternion that represents the rotation that maps plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.
  - Rotation(angle, axisOfRotation): Returns the unit quaternion cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.
  - Slerp(a, b, t): Interpolates between two quaternions, using spherical linear interpolation.
  - DistanceTo(q): Computes the distance or norm of the difference between this and another quaternion.
  - EpsilonEquals(other, epsilon): Check that all values in other are within epsilon of the values in this
  - Equals(other): Determines whether this quaternion has the same value of another quaternion.
  - Equals(obj): Determines whether an object is a quaternion and has the same value of this quaternion.
  - GetEulerZYZ(alpha, beta, gamma): Find the Euler angles for a rotation transformation.
  - GetHashCode(): Gets a non-unique but repeatable hashing code for this quaternion.
  - GetRotation(plane): Returns the frame created by applying the quaternion's rotation to the canonical world frame (1,0,0),(0,1,0),(0,0,1).
  - GetRotation(angle, axis): Returns the rotation defined by the quaternion.
  - GetRotation(xform): Returns a transformation matrix that performs the rotation defined by the quaternion. The transformation returned by this method has the property that xform * V = q.Rotate(V). If the quaternion is not unitized, the rotation of its unitized form is returned.
  - GetYawPitchRoll(yaw, pitch, roll): Find sthe Tait-Byran angles, also loosely called Euler angles, for this quaternion.
  - Invert(): Modifies this quaternion to become (a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2), where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d). This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0).
  - MatrixForm(): Returns 4x4 real valued matrix form of the quaternion a b c d -b a -d c -c d a -b -d -c b a which has the same arithmetic properties as the quaternion.
  - Rotate(v): Rotates a 3d vector. This operation is also called conjugation, because the result is the same as (q.Conjugate()*(0,x,y,x)*q/q.LengthSquared).Vector.
  - Set(a, b, c, d): Sets all coefficients of the quaternion.
  - SetRotation(plane0, plane1): Sets the quaternion to the unit quaternion which rotates plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.
  - SetRotation(angle, axisOfRotation): Sets the quaternion to cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.
  - ToString(): Returns a string representation of this Quaternion.
  - Unitize(): Scales the quaternion's coordinates so that a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d = 1.

instruction: What methods are available on RhinoCommon SubD?
code:
# Rhino.Geometry.SubD methods:
  - CreateFromCylinder(cylinder, circumferenceFaceCount, heightFaceCount, endCapStyle, endCapEdgeTag, radiusLocation): Creates a SubD form of a cylinder.
  - CreateFromLoft(curves, closed, addCorners, addCreases, divisions): Creates a SubD lofted through shape curves.
  - CreateFromMesh(mesh, options): Create a new SubD from a mesh.
  - CreateFromMesh(mesh): Create a new SubD from a mesh.
  - CreateFromSurface(surface, method, corners): Create a SubD that approximates the surface. If the surface is a SubD friendly NURBS surface and withCorners is true, then the SubD and input surface will have the same geometry.
  - CreateFromSweep(rail1, shapes, closed, addCorners, roadlikeFrame, roadlikeNormal): Fits a SubD through a series of profile curves that define the SubD cross-sections and one curve that defines a SubD edge.
  - CreateFromSweep(rail1, rail2, shapes, closed, addCorners): Fits a SubD through a series of profile curves that define the SubD cross-sections and two curves that defines SubD edges.
  - CreateGlobeSphere(sphere, vertexLocation, axialFaceCount, equatorialFaceCount): Creates a SubD sphere made from polar triangle fans and bands of quads. The result resembles a globe with triangle fans at the poles and the edges forming latitude parallels and longitude meridians.
  - CreateIcosahedron(sphere, vertexLocation): Creates a SubD sphere based on an icosohedron (20 triangular faces and 5 valent vertices). This is a goofy topology for a Catmull-Clark subdivision surface (all triangles, all vertices have 5 edges). You may want to consider using the much behaved result from CreateSubDQuadSphere(sphere, vertexLocation, 1) or even the result from CreateSubDGlobeSphere().
  - CreateQuadSphere(sphere, vertexLocation, quadSubdivisionLevel): Creates a SubD sphere made from quad faces.
  - CreateTriSphere(sphere, vertexLocation, triSubdivisionLevel): Creates a SubD sphere made from triangular faces. This is a goofy topology for a Catmull-Clark subdivision surface (all triangles and all vertices have 5 or 6 edges). You may want to consider using the much behaved result from CreateSubDQuadSphere() or even the result from CreateSubDGlobeSphere().
  - JoinSubDs(subdsToJoin, tolerance, joinedEdgesAreCreases, preserveSymmetry): Joins an enumeration of SubDs to form as few as possible resulting SubDs. There may be more than one SubD in the result array.
  - JoinSubDs(subdsToJoin, tolerance, joinedEdgesAreCreases): Joins an enumeration of SubDs to form as few as possible resulting SubDs. There may be more than one SubD in the result array.
  - ClearEvaluationCache(): Clear all cached evaluation information (meshes, surface points, bounding boxes, ...) that depends on edge tags, vertex tags, and the location of vertex control points.
  - ComponentFromComponentIndex(componentIndex): Returns a SubDComponent, either a SubDEdge, SubDFace, or SubDVertex, from a component index.
  - CopyEvaluationCache(src): Expert function that copies cached evaluations of component subdivision points and limit surface information from src to this. Typically this is done for performance critical situations like control point editing: - Copy a SubD to be modified (this does not copy the evaluation cache) - Copy the evaluation cache from the unmodified SubD - Modify the SubD copy - Update the surface mesh cache so that only the modified parts are recalculated - Display, meshing, bounding boxes on the modified SubD are now available
  - DuplicateEdgeCurves(): Gets Nurbs form of all edges in this SubD, with clamped knots. NB: Does not update the SubD evaluation cache before getting the edges.
  - DuplicateEdgeCurves(boundaryOnly, interiorOnly, smoothOnly, sharpOnly, creaseOnly, clampEnds): Gets Nurbs form of edges in this SubD. NB: Does not update the SubD evaluation cache before getting the edges.
  - Flip(): Reverses the orientation of all SubD normals.
  - InterpolateSurfacePoints(surfacePoints): Modifies the SubD so that the SubD vertex limit surface points are equal to surface_points[]
  - InterpolateSurfacePoints(vertexIndices, surfacePoints): Modifies the SubD so that the SubD vertex limit surface points of the listed vertices are equal to surface_points[].
  - MergeAllCoplanarFaces(tolerance, angleTolerance): Merges adjacent coplanar faces into single faces.
  - MergeAllCoplanarFaces(tolerance): Merges adjacent coplanar faces into single faces.
  - Offset(distance, solidify): Makes a new SubD with vertices offset at distance in the direction of the control net vertex normals. Optionally, based on the value of solidify, adds the input SubD and a ribbon of faces along any naked edges.
  - PackFaces(): Resets the SubD to the default face packing if adding creases or deleting faces breaks the quad grids. It does not change the topology or geometry of the SubD. SubD face packs always stop at creases.
  - SetVertexSurfacePoint(vertexIndex, surfacePoint): Set the location of a single vertex surface point. This function is not suitable for setting the locations of multiple vertex surface points that are topologically near to each other.
  - Subdivide(): Apply the Catmull-Clark subdivision algorithm and save the results in this SubD.
  - Subdivide(faceIndices): Apply the Catmull-Clark subdivision algorithm and save the results in this SubD.
  - Subdivide(count): Apply the Catmull-Clark subdivision algorithm and save the results in this SubD.
  - SurfaceMeshCacheExists(bTextureCoordinatesExist, bCurvaturesExist, bColorsExist): Checks that a surface mesh evaluation cache exists, and that it has the required options. This cache is used by - SubDVertex.SurfacePoint() , - SubDEdge.ToNurbsCurve(bool) , and - Mesh.CreateFromSubD(SubD, int) .

# Rhino.Geometry.SubDDisplayParameters methods:
  - AbsoluteDisplayDensityFromSubD(adaptiveSubDDisplayDensity, subd): Gets absolute SubD display density for subd.

  - CreateFromAbsoluteDisplayDensity(absoluteSubDDisplayDensity): Use of absolute display density is strongly discouraged. SubDs can have a single face or millions of faces. Adaptive display meshing produces more desirable results in almost all cases.

  - Default(): Parameters for the default limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.DefaultDensity.
  - Empty(): Get an empty SubDDisplayParameters.
  - ExtraCoarse(): Parameters for an extra course limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraCoarseDensity.
  - ExtraFine(): Parameters for an extra fine limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.ExtraFineDensity.
  - Fine(): Parameters for a fine limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.FineDensity.
  - FromEncodedString(value): Converts encoded serialized string into a MeshingParameters
  - Medium(): Parameters for a medium limit surface display mesh. SubD display density = adaptive SubDDisplayParameters.Density.MediumDensity.
  - DisplayDensity(subd): Gets the absolute display density to use when creating display meshes for SubD. When adaptive reduction is enabled, subd.Faces.Count is used to determine the appropriate display density.
  - Dispose(): Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.
  - GetObjectData(info, context): 
  - SetAbsoluteDisplayDensity(absoluteDisplayDensity): In almast all cases, you are better off using SetAdaptiveDisplayDensity().
  - SetAdaptiveDisplayDensity(adaptiveDisplayDensity): Set an adaptive SubD display density that caps display mesh quad count at SubDDisplayParameters.AdaptiveDisplayMeshQuadMaximum.
  - ToEncodedString(): Returns a encoded string that represents the MeshingParameters.
